sense.name: common
sense.commentary: INTERACTION[+event] a mutual or reciprocal action; interacting
sense.examples: The interaction between the children took place on Tuesday. Human-computer interaction is much more frequent now than five years ago. There is very little interaction between the dog and cat in this comic strip.

sense.name: physics
sense.commentary: INTERACTION[+event] (physics) the transfer of energy between elementary particles or between an elementary particle and a field or between fields; mediated by gauge bosons
sense.examples: Chapter three is about atom-wall interaction. If the particle can participate in an interaction process, this experiment will be advantageous.
